evidence.text: unlawful and unjustified police shooting of an unarmed and defenseless Latoya Ratlieff on May 31, 2020, during her peaceful participation in a public demonstration at the “George Floyd Demonstrations” in Fort Lauderdale, Florida.

extracted.value: Unlawful police shooting of Ms. Ratlieff on May 31, 2020 during a public demonstration in Fort Lauderdale, Florida.

evidence.text: public parking garage at S.E. 2nd Street and S.E. 1st Avenue, Fort Lauderdale, Florida

extracted.value: Incident occurred at a public parking garage at S.E. 2nd Street and S.E. 1st Avenue, Fort Lauderdale, Florida.
Ms. Ratlieff was unarmed and defenseless during the demonstration.
Police officers used tear gas and kinetic impact projectiles (KIPs).

evidence.text: the police had no warning or dispersal order

extracted.value: Police did not issue a warning or dispersal order before using force.

evidence.text: Ramos ... shot Ms. Ratlieff in the eye with a direct impact round

extracted.value: Officer Ramos shot Ms. Ratlieff in the eye with a direct impact round.
Police had no lawful justification for using force.

evidence.text: yellow zone (i.e., the abdomen area) and red zone (i.e., the lower back, chest, groin area, and head)

extracted.value: Police targeted the yellow zone (abdomen) and red zone (lower back, chest, groin, head).

evidence.text: the gathering was peaceful and without incident

extracted.value: The demonstration was peaceful and without incident.

evidence.text: Ms. Ratlieff was the great niece of Fannie Lou Hamer

extracted.value: Ms. Ratlieff is the great niece of Fannie Lou Hamer.

evidence.text: Figueras was a S.W.A.T. commander. Figueras is a citizen of the State of Florida and is over the age of 18. On information and belief, he resides in Broward County, Florida.

extracted.value: Defendant Figueras was a S.W.A.T. commander; citizen of Florida; residing in Broward County; over 18.

evidence.text: Vendors of chemical munitions and riot control agents market them as aerosols containing ingredients formulated to provide a reliable means to incapacitate targets and others in the vicinity. An “OC chemical munition,” such as pepper spray, is one such type of riot control agent. The active ingredient in pepper spray is oleoresin capsicum.

extracted.value: Chemical munitions such as tear gas and pepper spray are aerosolized riot control agents, with oleoresin capsicum as the active ingredient, used to incapacitate targets.

evidence.text: disperse the peaceful gathering. The demonstration was never declared unlawful, as provided by Florida law and FLPD policies. No dispersal order issued. ... The City, FLPD, and the individual defendants deployed tear gas and KIPs to disperse peaceful demonstrators.

extracted.value: Police used tear gas and KIPs to disperse peaceful demonstrators; no dispersal order was issued; the demonstration was not declared unlawful; the City and FLPD had sufficient time to issue an order.
